member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity
member.summary: Calculates a magnitude-per-unit area from point or polyline features using a kernel function to fit a smoothly tapered surface to each point or polyline.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input features (point or line) for which to calculate the density. (In, Required)
Field denoting population values for each feature. The population field is the count or quantity to be spread across the landscape to create a continuous surface. (In, Required)
The output kernel density raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.in_features
member.summary: The input features (point or line) for which to calculate the density. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.population_field
member.summary: Field denoting population values for each feature. The population field is the count or quantity to be spread across the landscape to create a continuous surface. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.out_raster
member.summary: The output kernel density raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.cell_size
member.summary: The cell size of the output raster that will be created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.search_radius
member.summary: The search radius within which to calculate density. Units are based on the linear unit of the projection of the output spatial reference. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.area_unit_scale_factor
member.summary: The desired area units of the output density values. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.out_cell_values
member.summary: Determines what the values in the output raster represent. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.KernelDensity.method
member.summary: Determines whether to use a shortest path on a spheroid (geodesic) or a flat earth (planar) method. It is strongly suggested to use the geodesic method with data stored in a coordinate system that is not appropriate for distance measurements (for example, Web Mercator or any geographic coordinate system) and any analysis that spans a large geographic area. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation
member.summary: Calculates, for each cell, its least-cost source based on the least accumulative cost over a cost surface.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input source locations. (In, Required)
A raster defining the impedance or cost to move planimetrically through each cell. (In, Required)
The output cost allocation raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.in_source_data
member.summary: The input source locations. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.in_cost_raster
member.summary: A raster defining the impedance or cost to move planimetrically through each cell. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.out_allocation_raster
member.summary: The output cost allocation raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.maximum_distance
member.summary: The threshold that the accumulative cost values cannot exceed. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.in_value_raster
member.summary: The input integer raster that identifies the zone values that will be used for each input source location. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_field
member.summary: The field used to assign values to the source locations. It must be of integer type. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.out_distance_raster
member.summary: The output cost distance raster. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.out_backlink_raster
member.summary: The output cost backlink raster. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_cost_multiplier
member.summary: The multiplier to apply to the cost values. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_start_cost
member.summary: The starting cost from which to begin the cost calculations. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_resistance_rate
member.summary: This parameter simulates the increase in the effort to overcome costs as the accumulative cost increases. It is used to model fatigue of the traveler. The growing accumulative cost to reach a cell is multiplied by the resistance rate and added to the cost to move into the subsequent cell. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_capacity
member.summary: The cost capacity for the traveler for a source. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.source_direction
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the traveler when applying the source resistance rate and the source starting cost. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostAllocation.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The field used to assign values to the source locations. It must be of integer type. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The multiplier to apply to the cost values. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The starting cost from which to begin the cost calculations. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.PathAllocation.source_resistance_rate
member.summary: This parameter simulates the increase in the effort to overcome costs as the accumulative cost increases. It is used to model fatigue of the traveler. The growing accumulative cost to reach a cell is multiplied by the resistance rate and added to the cost to move into the subsequent cell. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The cost capacity for the traveler for a source. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.PathAllocation.source_direction
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the traveler when applying horizontal and vertical factors, the source resistance rate, and the source starting cost. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Performs a maximum likelihood classification on a set of raster bands and creates a classified raster as output.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input raster bands. (In, Required)
The input signature file whose class signatures are used by the maximum likelihood classifier. (In, Required)
The output classified raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.in_raster_bands
member.summary: The input raster bands. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.in_signature_file
member.summary: The input signature file whose class signatures are used by the maximum likelihood classifier. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output classified raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.reject_fraction
member.summary: This value determines whether a cell will be classified based on its likelihood of being correctly assigned to one of the classes. Cells that have a likelihood of being correctly assigned to any of the classes that is lower than the reject fraction will be given a value of NoData in the resulting classified raster. Cells whose likelihood of being correctly assigned to any of the classes is lower than the reject fraction will be given a value of NoData in the output classified raster. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.a_priori_probabilities
member.summary: Specifies how a priori probabilities will be determined. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.in_a_priori_file
member.summary: A text file containing a priori probabilities for the input signature classes. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.MLClassify.out_confidence_raster
member.summary: The output confidence raster dataset shows the certainty of the classification in 14 levels of confidence, with the lowest values representing the highest reliability. If there are no cells classified at a particular confidence level, that confidence level will not be present in the output confidence raster. (Out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: Number of ground x,y units in one surface z unit. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Allows correction for the earth's curvature. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Coefficient of the refraction of visible light in air. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.surface_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance to be added to the z-value of each cell as it is considered for visibility. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.observer_elevation
member.summary: This value is used to define the surface elevations of the observer points or vertices. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.observer_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance to be added to the observer elevation. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.inner_radius
member.summary: This value defines the start distance from which visibility is determined. Cells closer than this distance are not visible in the output but can still block visibility of the cells between inner radius and outer radius. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.outer_radius
member.summary: This value defines the maximum distance from which visibility is determined. Cells beyond this distance are excluded from the analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.horizontal_start_angle
member.summary: This value defines the start angle of the horizontal scan range. The value should be specified in degrees from 0 to 360, either as integer or floating point, with 0 oriented to north. The default value is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.horizontal_end_angle
member.summary: This value defines the end angle of the horizontal scan range. The value should be specified in degrees from 0 to 360, either as integer or floating point, with 0 oriented to north. The default value is 360. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.vertical_upper_angle
member.summary: This value defines the upper vertical angle limit of the scan relative to the horizontal plane. The value is specified in degrees, and can be integer or floating point. The allowed range is from above -90 up to and including 90. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Visibility.vertical_lower_angle
member.summary: This value defines the lower vertical angle limit of the scan relative to the horizontal plane. The value is specified in degrees, and can be integer or floating point. The allowed range is from -90 up to (but not including) 90. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Determines the raster surface locations visible to a set of observer features using geodesic methods

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input surface raster. It can be an integer or a floating-point raster. (In, Required)
The input feature class that identifies the observer locations. It can be point, multipoint, or polyline features. (In, Required)
The output raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.in_raster
member.summary: The input surface raster. It can be an integer or a floating-point raster. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.in_observer_features
member.summary: The input feature class that identifies the observer locations. It can be point, multipoint, or polyline features. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output raster. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The output above ground level (AGL) raster. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.analysis_type
member.summary: Choose which type of visibility analysis you wish to perform, either determining how visible each cell is to the observers, or identifying for each surface location which observers are visible. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.vertical_error
member.summary: The amount of uncertainty (the Root Mean Square error, or RMSE) in the surface elevation values. It is a floating-point value representing the expected error of the input elevation values. When this parameter is assigned a value greater than 0, the output visibility raster will be floating point. In this case, each cell value on the output visibility raster represents the sum of probabilities that the cell is visible to any of the observers. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.out_observer_region_relationship_table
member.summary: The output table for identifying the regions that are visible to each observer. This table can be related to the input observer feature class and the output visibility raster for identifying the regions visible to given observers. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.refractivity_coefficient
member.summary: Coefficient of the refraction of visible light in air. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.surface_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance to be added to the z-value of each cell as it is considered for visibility. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.observer_elevation
member.summary: This value is used to define the surface elevations of the observer points or vertices. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.Viewshed2.observer_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance to be added to the observer elevation. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specifies the level of importance given to the spectral differences of features in your imagery. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specifies the level of importance given to the proximity between features in your imagery. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.SegmentMeanShift.min_segment_size
member.summary: Merge segments smaller than this size with their best fitting neighbor segment. This is related to the minimum mapping unit for your project. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.SegmentMeanShift.band_indexes
member.summary: Select the bands you want to use to segment your imagery, separated by a space. If no band indexes are specified, they are chosen by the following criteria: If the raster has only 3 bands, those 3 bands are used If the raster has more than 3 bands, the tool assigns the red, green and blue bands according to the raster's properties.If the red, green and blue bands are not identified in the raster dataset's properties, bands 1, 2, and 3 are used. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Generates an Esri classifier definition (.ecd) file using the Iso Cluster classification definition.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.#ctor(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The raster dataset to classify. (In, Required)
Maximum number of desired classes to group pixels or segments. This should be set to be greater than the number of classes in your legend. (In, Required)
The output JSON file that contains attribute information, statistics, hyperplane vectors, and other information for the classifier. An .ecd file is created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.in_raster
member.summary: The raster dataset to classify. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.max_classes
member.summary: Maximum number of desired classes to group pixels or segments. This should be set to be greater than the number of classes in your legend. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.out_classifier_definition
member.summary: The output JSON file that contains attribute information, statistics, hyperplane vectors, and other information for the classifier. An .ecd file is created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.in_additional_raster
member.summary: Incorporate ancillary raster datasets, such as a multispectral image or a DEM, to generate attributes and other required information for classification. This parameter is optional. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.max_iterations
member.summary: The maximum number of iterations for the clustering process to run. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.min_samples_per_cluster
member.summary: The minimum number of pixels or segments in a valid cluster or class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.skip_factor
member.summary: Number of pixels to skip for a pixel image input. If a segmented image is an input, specify the number of segments to skip. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.used_attributes
member.summary: Specifies the attributes to be included in the attribute table associated with the output raster. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.max_merge_per_iter
member.summary: The maximum number of cluster merges per iteration. Increasing the number of merges will reduce the number of classes that are created. A lower value will result in more classes. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.TrainIsoClusterClassifier.max_merge_distance
member.summary: The maximum distance between cluster centers in feature space. Increasing the distance will allow more clusters to merge, resulting in fewer classes. A lower value will result in more classes. Values from 0 to 5 tend to give the best results. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions
member.summary: Identifies the best regions, or groups of contiguous cells, from an input utility (suitability) raster that satisfy a specified evaluation criterion and that meet identified shape, size, number, and interregion distance constraints.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input utility raster from which the regions will be derived. (In, Required)
The output regions raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.in_raster
member.summary: The input utility raster from which the regions will be derived. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.out_raster
member.summary: The output regions raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.total_area
member.summary: The total amount of area for all regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.area_units
member.summary: Defines the area units used for the total_area, minimum_area, and maximum_area parameters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.number_of_regions
member.summary: Determines how many regions the total_area will be distributed across. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.region_shape
member.summary: Defines the shape characteristics for the output regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.region_orientation
member.summary: Defines the orientation of the defined shape. Regions are grown out from the seed locations with preference given to the cells that maintain the desired orientation of the region shapes. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.shape_tradeoff
member.summary: Identifies the weight for the cells when growing the candidate regions in the parameterized region-growing algorithm. The weighting is a tradeoff between a cell's contribution for maintaining the region shape relative to the utility contribution of the cell's attribute value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.evaluation_method
member.summary: The evaluation criteria to be used for determining which of the candidate regions identified in the parameterized region-growing algorithm are most preferred. The preference can be specified based on a particular statistic of the utility values, or spatial arrangement of the cells within the regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.minimum_area
member.summary: Define the minimum area allowed for each region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.maximum_area
member.summary: Define the maximum area allowed for each region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.minimum_distance
member.summary: Define the minimum distance allowed between regions. No two regions can be within this distance. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.maximum_distance
member.summary: Define the maximum distance allowed between regions. No region can be farther apart than this distance from at least one other region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.distance_units
member.summary: Defines the distance units that will be used for the minimum_distance and maximum_distance parameters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.in_existing_regions
member.summary: A dataset identifying where regions already exist. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.number_of_neighbors
member.summary: Defines which neighboring cells to use in the growth of the regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.no_islands
member.summary: Defines if islands will be allowed within the potential regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.region_seeds
member.summary: Defines the number of seeds from which to grow the potential regions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.region_resolution
member.summary: Sets the resolution at which region growth occurs. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.LocateRegions.selection_method
member.summary: Identifies how the regions will be selected. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance
member.summary: Computes, for each cell, the horizontal or vertical component of downslope distance, following the flow path(s), to cell(s) on a stream into which they flow. In case of multiple flow paths, minimum, weighted mean, or maximum flow distance can be computed.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: An input stream raster that represents a linear stream network. (In, Required)
The input raster representing a continuous surface. (In, Required)
The output flow distance raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.in_stream_raster
member.summary: An input stream raster that represents a linear stream network. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.in_surface_raster
member.summary: The input raster representing a continuous surface. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.out_raster
member.summary: The output flow distance raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.in_flow_direction_raster
member.summary: The input raster that shows the direction of flow out of each cell. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.distance_type
member.summary: Determines if the vertical or horizontal component of flow distance is calculated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.flow_direction_type
member.summary: The input flow direction raster can be of type D8, Multi Flow Direction (MFD) or D-Infinity (DINF). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.FlowDistance.statistics_type
member.summary: Determines the statistics type used to compute flow distance over multiple flow paths. If there is only a single flow path from each cell to a cell on the stream, all statistics types produce the same result. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints
member.summary: Generates training samples from seed points, such as accuracy assessment points or training sample points. A typical use case is generating training samples from an existing source, such as a thematic raster or a feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The data source that labels the training samples. (In, Required)
A point shapefile or feature class to provide the centers of training sample polygons. (In, Required)

The output training sample feature class in the format that can be used in training tools, including shapefiles. The output feature class can be either a polygon feature class or a point feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.in_class_data
member.summary: The data source that labels the training samples. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.in_seed_points
member.summary: A point shapefile or feature class to provide the centers of training sample polygons. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.out_training_feature_class
member.summary: The output training sample feature class in the format that can be used in training tools, including shapefiles. The output feature class can be either a polygon feature class or a point feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.min_sample_area
member.summary: The minimum area needed for each training sample, in square meters. The minimum value must be greater than or equal to 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.max_sample_radius
member.summary: The longest distance (in meters) from any point within the training sample to its center seed point. If set to 0, the output training sample will be points instead of polygons. The minimum value must be greater than or equal to 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.GenerateTrainingSamplesFromSeedPoints.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples
member.summary: Estimates the accuracy of individual training samples. The cross validation accuracy is computed using the previously generated classification training result in an .ecd file and the training samples. Outputs include a raster dataset containing the misclassified class values and a training sample dataset with the accuracy score for each training sample.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input raster to be classified. (In, Required)
A training sample feature class created in the Training Samples Manager pane. (In, Required)

The .ecd output classifier file from any of the train classifier tools. The .ecd file is a JSON file that contains attribute information, statistics, or other information needed for the classifier. (In, Required)
The output individual training samples saved as a feature class. The associated attribute table contains an addition field listing the accuracy score. (Out, Required)

The output misclassified raster having NoData outside training samples. In training samples, correctly classified pixels are represented as NoData, and misclassified pixels are represented by their class value. The results is an index map of misclassified class values. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.in_raster
member.summary: The input raster to be classified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.in_training_features
member.summary: A training sample feature class created in the Training Samples Manager pane. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.in_classifier_definition
member.summary: The .ecd output classifier file from any of the train classifier tools. The .ecd file is a JSON file that contains attribute information, statistics, or other information needed for the classifier. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.out_training_feature_class
member.summary: The output individual training samples saved as a feature class. The associated attribute table contains an addition field listing the accuracy score. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.out_misclassified_raster
member.summary: The output misclassified raster having NoData outside training samples. In training samples, correctly classified pixels are represented as NoData, and misclassified pixels are represented by their class value. The results is an index map of misclassified class values. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.in_additional_raster
member.summary: Incorporate ancillary raster datasets, such as a multispectral image or a DEM, to generate attributes and other required information for the classifier. This raster will be needed when calculating attributes such as mean or standard deviation. This parameter is optional. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.InspectTrainingSamples.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline
member.summary: Calculates the least-cost path from a source to a destination as a line feature.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: A raster or feature dataset that identifies those cells from which the least-cost path is determined to the least costly source. (In, Required)
The cost distance raster to be used to determine the least-cost path from the sources to the destinations. (In, Required)
The cost backlink raster to be used to determine the path to return to a source via the least-cost path, or the shortest path. (In, Required)
The output feature class that will hold the least cost path. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.in_destination_data
member.summary: A raster or feature dataset that identifies those cells from which the least-cost path is determined to the least costly source. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.in_cost_distance_raster
member.summary: The cost distance raster to be used to determine the least-cost path from the sources to the destinations. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.in_cost_backlink_raster
member.summary: The cost backlink raster to be used to determine the path to return to a source via the least-cost path, or the shortest path. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.out_polyline_features
member.summary: The output feature class that will hold the least cost path. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.path_type
member.summary: Specifies a keyword defining the manner in which the values and zones on the input destination data will be interpreted in the cost path calculations. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.destination_field
member.summary: The field to be used to obtain values for the destination locations. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.CostPathAsPolyline.force_flow_direction_convention
member.summary: Forces the tool to treat the input backlink raster as a flow direction raster. Flow direction rasters can have integer with values from 0-255. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning
member.summary: Uses a remote sensing image to convert labeled vector or raster data into deep learning training datasets. The output is a folder of image chips and a folder of metadata files in the specified format.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input source imagery, typically multispectral imagery. (In, Required)
The folder where the output image chips and metadata will be stored. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.in_raster
member.summary: The input source imagery, typically multispectral imagery. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.out_folder
member.summary: The folder where the output image chips and metadata will be stored. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.in_class_data
member.summary: The training sample data, in either vector or raster form. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.image_chip_format
member.summary: Specifies the raster format for the image chip outputs. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The size of the image chips for the X dimension. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.tile_size_y
member.summary: The size of the image chips for the Y dimension. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.stride_x
member.summary: The distance to move in the X direction when creating the next image chips. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.stride_y
member.summary: The distance to move in the Y direction when creating the next image chips. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.output_nofeature_tiles
member.summary: Specifies whether image chips that do not capture training samples will be exported. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.metadata_format
member.summary: Specifies the format of the output metadata labels. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.start_index
member.summary: The start index for the sequence of image chips. This allows you to append more image chips to an existing sequence. The default value is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.class_value_field
member.summary: The field that contains the class values. If no field is specified, the system searches for a value or classvalue field. If the feature does not contain a class field, the system determines that all records belong to one class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.SpatialAnalystTools.ExportTrainingDataForDeepLearning.buffer_radius
member.summary: The radius for a buffer around each training sample to delineate a training sample area. This allows you to create circular polygon training samples from points. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Calculates, for each cell, the direction, in degrees, to the neighboring cell along the shortest path back to the closest source while avoiding barriers.
